(1) Decide what your best skills and interests are. You do this through trying out hobbies, exploring the world, visiting local attractions, reading books, playing games, building something, forming a club or anything you see online or offline that you want to do. (2) Decide which skills you will work to improve if needed. Once you choose a direction, it’s continual education from then on. (3) Set high standards of quality in all your work. “Do It Right The First Time” is a topic for you to explore and get to know well. (4) Branding - Do or be something that has a name or identity. (5) Establish Trust - Get and configure a profile. Get a website, blog or at least a LinkedIn account, something that is public that requires a number of steps to complete. (6) Be available when you are called to work. Follow rules at work. Connect with people while you are there. Participate in company events. Learn how to communicate issues you may have with work or with other workers. (7) Keep money safe in a trusted local financial institution. Seek advice from qualified financial advisers with your interests in mind. (Jon Oliver has a good video on this topic that I liked. You will have to search for that on YouTube.) (8) Realize that your financial status is what you earn minus your expenses — your “net worth”. It varies by your location, your currency and your economic level. You can learn to live with less if you reduce expenses. Decide what must be top quality (your computer, phone, etc.) and what you can do with at a lower price (generic foods, e.g.). Quick Answer EDUCATION - Never Stop Learning

Funny enough, there are lots of ways to earn lots of money. I wrote 112 Profitable Side Hustle Ideas You Can Start Doing Today with the intent of giving people options for earning more money. I’ll share a few of those in this answer and provide more of a framework for how you can earn lots of money.  First, it’s important to understand why exactly you want to earn “lots of money.” Think about it for a second. Why do you want to earn lots of money? What are you wishing to buy with this money? What are you hoping this money will bring you? Second, you’ll want to clarify how much money you want to earn, as this influences the activities you’ll pursue. “Lots of money” is way too vague - make the number concrete. Is it… $100,000? $500,000? $1,000,000? $100,000,000? Get clear on just how much money you want to make. Third, consider the time frame you have for earning lots of money. Do you want to make a lot of money in… 6 months? 1 year? 5 years? Making money takes time. If you’re like Walter White in Breaking Bad, and want to simply make as much as possible, you could become a world-class drug dealer (Not advised), but of course that has its consequences. So think about how much time you’ll give yourself to make the amount of money you want to make. Lastly, think about the time you’re willing to commit to making money. How much time and effort are you really willing to put into making money? Seriously, lots of people say they want to make lots of money, but few are willing to put in the time and effort. Be honest with yourself, but think about how much time and effort you’re willing to put in to making money. So, how the heck do you get started?  As I mentioned previously, there are lots of ways to make lots of money, so choose the method you think you can execute. What I mean is, pick a method for earning money that you have the skills, passion, and desire to turn into a reality. When I was just getting started in my career I was a personal trainer. However, I knew I wouldn’t make the amount of money I wanted to make simply by training clients at the gym. So I created Just Go Fitness to train clients in their homes, at parks, and eventually online. I made thousands of dollars through this, a dramatic increase to the amount of money I was making at the gym. You have to find what will work best for you. I’m not sure how much money you want to make, but here are some options: Freelancing through UpWorkCreate your own consulting companyStart a web design companyCreate a content writing companySell products on AmazonCreate a blog and monetize through online courses, affiliate marketing, and advertisingStart a podcast and monetize through advertisingCreate an event coordinating companyStart a personal chef serviceSell real estateTrade stocksDevelop apps for peopleCreate your own appSell products on EtsyCreate a digital marketing agencyStart a membership siteCreate a new subscription boxStart a Shopify store and dropship productsWrite a book and sell itCreate a YouTube show and sponsor it through PatreonThere are so many ways to make money, especially with the internet and all the resources it provides. Find that thing YOU want to do and work every day to grow it. Good luck! Justin 112 Side Hustle Ideas

Back in the golden age of golden nuggets.  Yeah, that’s diamond, I know. Thank you for the comment anyway. A long time ago in a country not so faraway lived many peeps. All were greedy-grunchy gold diggers. They lived to dig. They lived to find gold. All they had? A pickaxe and an incredible greediness. They wanted to find gold. Not a simple golden nugget. Tai Lopez bank account of gold. With such aspirations, how could they give up? They couldn’t. All their life resolved around mining. After waking up, they would sharpen their pickaxe. Then, go to the nearest mine. And mine. And dig. And hope. Most days, they came back with nothing except back pain. “Maybe the spot doesn’t have any gold” thought out loud one of the smartest miners. He was 60 years old but never touched a single golden nugget. In over a century, he was the first one with the idea of going somewhere else. With dozens of young and robust men, he moved to the next valley. They set up their camp. Slept. And started again their endless mining ritual. They did so for several months. 8 of the 12 vigorous miners came back more depressed than ever to the original camp. 4 were still in the valley. 2 weeks after, they found a gargantuan cave full of gold. More than a treasure, it was astonishing. Butt. The 8 peeps who leaved earlier? They got nothing. Peanuts. When you want to make money, the same applies to you guys! Give up too early and you’ll come back with peanuts! That’s exactly why I drop golden nuggets on my daily mailing list. Get them! Don’t miss the fun - and the gold.

Important Realization : Many of the Wealthy folks also started from their way down. They also went to the same years of growing up like normal people, they went through the same educational system…. You get the drift I believe it is their Attitude towards money that helped them catapult them to the great heights where they stand right now. The biggest thing holding back most people from striking it big are their thoughts, beliefs and philosophies about money So I will be listing some of the ways in which the successful people handled money, how they perceive it and utilize it. 1. The wealthy focus on earning. The masses focus on how to protect and hoard their money. The wealthy also know saving is important. But they know earning money is even more important. Most people are more concerned with the modest gains they accumulate from their savings and investments than they are with using their billion-dollar minds to create a fortune. Instead of focusing on clipping coupons and living frugally, the wealthy reject the nickel-and-dime thinking of the masses and focus their mental energy where it belongs: on the big money. You gotta choose: Save Or Earn?  2. The wealthy use leverage. Leverage basically translates into using lesser efforts to get bigger payouts In the minds of millionaires, leverage is everything. The wealthy strategically focus their efforts on the most profitable areas of their businesses while leveraging their contacts, credibility, and resources to maximize the results of every action they take. The middle class sees hard work as a badge of honor. The wealthy sees success as a more important badge of honor. Think about what you were taught about hard work growing up. If you're not exactly raking in the money, make a decision to let go of any limiting beliefs you have about hard work, and start thinking about how you can use leverage to become more successful. Use leverage to strategically achieve more with less !!  3. The wealthy think about money in non-linear terms. The masses trade time for money. This creates the belief that making money is a linear process directly connected to time. The average person believes the only way to earn more money - with the exception of raises and bonuses - is to work more hours. Millionaires know big money requires thinking about it in non-linear terms. They are masters at generating money through ideas that solve problems. They realize there is no limit to ideas; therefore, there is no limit to how much money they can earn. Fortunes can be created almost overnight with the right idea at the right time, but only if the creator understands this non-linear phenomenon. Translate that idea into money !  If you follow these simple rules, I believe success wont be elusive anymore, It would all depend on the quantum of your efforts how smartly you deploy leverage PS: I have already started following this path…You would have to buck up if you want to catch up!! Thanks For Reading !

Getting Started as a Freelancer : To get started, check out jobs on freelancer websites like People per Hour and Up work. By browsing these sites you will get a good understanding of what freelance jobs are available. And although the majority of the jobs on these sites are quite low paid, they are a great place to start. Once you have decided what services you will offer as a freelancer (keep reading to find out more on freelancing options), and have a couple of jobs under your belt, you should next create your own website. This will help you promote your services and showcase your work and testimonials from previous clients. You should also email websites in your niche to advertise your services and get your name out there as a professional in your field. As you become well known within your chosen industry, you will quite quickly find you are inundated with job offers. So now we know a bit about freelancing let’s have a look at some of the services you could offer as a freelancer… 1. Write for Blogs With so many blogs needing content, website owners are crying out for writers to produce interesting blog posts on a regular basis. Writing blog posts varies greatly in pay, from $5 to $250 for 1000 words. If you are serious about becoming a freelance writer, pick a niche and become an expert on this subject. Some subjects are much better paid than others, so although you may love the idea of writing about travel (badly paid) a better bet would be a niche like finance (much higher rates of pay). Check out the Pro Blogger job board for high paid freelance writing jobs – other places to look might be Text broker or you can look at the “gigs” section on Craigslist. 2. Copy writing Writing copy for websites is another great freelancing option for those who have a way with words. Copy writing can involve writing the text for websites, press releases, promotional offline materials including leaflets and brochures, and any other professional text for businesses. While writing blog posts is well paid it won’t make you as much money as writing copy for sales pages. However, clients can be more fussy, as they want the highest quality writing for the forefront of their website or advertising campaigns. Many freelance writers offer both copy writing and blog writing amongst their services. This can be a good way to juggle regular but lower paid clients (blogging) with the higher paid but ad-hoc project based copy work. 3. Virtual Assistant (VA) I have 3 V-As. I couldn’t function without them. It doesn’t matter how big or how small a business is, they all need help running their day-to-day administrative tasks. Virtual assistants perform a variety of tasks that a traditional assistant or secretary would normally do, including making travel arrangements, paying bills, or managing expense reimbursements. I use them to upload content, optimize images, brief writers etc. Virtual assistants typically work from home or wherever there’s an available Wi-Fi connection. They regularly interact with clients by phone, email, or Skype on behalf of their boss. How much can a virtual assistant actually make? It usually depends on their level of expertise and overall experience. 4. Write Industry Papers If you have a background in a specific field, you may find there is a demand for writing industry papers in your area of expertise. For example, there are often adverts for doctors, lawyers, nutritionists, and business experts from particular niches, to write white papers on different subject areas. These are well paid jobs that you will need to stake your reputation on, but that can often be worked on from the comfort of your own home. 5. Editing If you are a fast reader and have a good grasp of grammar and language then editing may be a good freelance role for you. Editing is a great way to quickly make money online, and there are always editing jobs available on freelance job sites. And the best part? Editor’s usually get paid per word, so the faster you can check through work the more money you will make per hour. 6. Website Design If you have an eye for design and some experience of creating websites, then you could offer your services as a freelance web designer. You will need to create your own stylish website and have a few other projects that you can show potential clients to demonstrate your skills. You will also need to initially spend time emailing businesses to promote your services and find work. Web design consists of mainly project-based jobs. However, you can offer ongoing maintenance for a monthly fee, which can be a good way to guarantee regular pay. Web design fees also differ greatly. So you will need to make the decision whether to target small businesses or compete for large clients with bigger budgets. Tools & Resources: I’ve written a pretty comprehensive guide on the best web design software that covers both free and premium software packages. If you’re serious about becoming a web designer, then I recommend purchasing the full Adobe Creative Cloud Suite. At $49.99 per month, this is probably a bargain considering what you can achieve with this set of tools. 7. Landing Page Design A spin-off for web designers is to offer a landing page creation service. Well-optimized landing pages can be the difference between a successful and a failing business. And, as creating the perfect landing page isn’t easy, this is a service many businesses are prepared to pay for. I know people who are earning 6 figures per year and all they do is create landing pages for businesses. There’s serious money to be made. With online software such as Click Funnels (review), Optin monster (review) or Sumo-me, landing page creation is extremely easy to do, which makes this method of making money online a real possibility. Tools & Resources Click Funnels is offering new customers a 14 Day Free Trial to use their extremely easy to use landing page/sales funnel design platform. Sign up for a 7 day free trial with Optin monster to get a taste of how easy it is to create high converting landing pages that you can potentially sell to your new clients. 8. Graphic Design There are many freelance options for graphic designers who are looking to make money online. Designing layouts and graphics for promotional material, corporate reports, magazines or book covers, are all tasks that businesses are looking for online freelancers to complete. Due to its flexible nature, graphic design possibilities can range from one-off projects to ongoing work with regular clients. Tools & Resources: Envato Elements has thousands of graphic elements and templates that you can use for graphic design client work, and can save you so much time and effort. Rather than creating your own graphics from scratch, you can use pre-designed elements and customize them to make them unique to you. 9. Create Logos Logos are a crucial part of any business, and a talented graphic designer that can produce eye-catching logos will be in great demand. Although there are many graphic design jobs advertised on freelance websites, pitching your services to businesses will enable you to command a better price for your work. Tools & Resources: Did you know that there’s logo generating services that you can use for free? I’ve written about them all over on my Best Free Logo Generators guide. 10. Produce Info graphics Info graphics are currently an extremely popular type of media. An info graphic showing information or data in an interesting and fun way can help engage an audience and generate numerous likes and shares. As info graphics take more time to create than just simply uploading an image, busy website owners are prepared to pay for custom info graphics. And don’t worry, an info graphic can be created using simple design software such a Canvas. So extensive graphic design skills are not necessary, just a creative eye. 11. Computer Programming If you have previous experience as a computer programmer or have skills in this field, then there is plenty of work you can pick up as a freelancer. If lack of confidence is holding you back, then Free Code Camp is an excellent way to get your foot in the coding door. This organization provides free courses where you will build real-life apps and programs, giving you experience and plenty to add to your CV. Tools & Resources: For the best coding tutorials and online courses check out Tree house. You can sign up for a free 7-day trial to see if it’s for you. I’ve completed many tutorials on Tree house over the years, and I can 100% recommend their courses. 12. App Development With apps being constantly developed, competent app developers are in high demand. Again, if you have the experience or skills to create successful apps then this could be something you could end up working on as a full-time freelancer. Check out adverts for developers on Toptal, a higher paying jobs site for experienced freelancers wanting to make money online. 13. Online PA If you have experience as a personal assistant, secretary, admin assistant, or something in a similar field, then becoming an online PA may be a great role for you. Many professionals want someone to help organize their business and personal affairs. Jobs could include sending emails, managing financial affairs, booking flights and arranging day-to-day activities. If you are interested in this line of work there are many PA agencies that are crying out for reliable assistants. 14. Social Marketing Manager Another strategy to make money online is to become a social marketing manager. Being present on social media is key for any business that wants to attract new customers, promote their products and grow their following. However, constantly posting, liking and commenting on the numerous social media channels is extremely time-consuming. More and more businesses are recruiting social media managers to run and organize all their social media. And to save money, social media employees are often employed as online freelancers. A social marketing manager could be asked to complete any tasks that are social media related. This could include scheduling all social media posts, running competitions, creating ad campaigns and much more, which can easily be done with social media management tools such as Sendible, Hootsuite or even these Instagram schedulers. Social media isn’t rocket science, so if you have an interest in this area of work, start small and work your way up. Once you have the experience of running social media projects, you can start to advertise yourself as an expert in the ‘social media’ field. Small business owners don’t have the time nor the expertise to grow their own social media following, so this is an area where you can capitalize. 15. Online Marketing Consultant If you have marketing experience then why not set yourself up as a freelance marketing consultant. Looking at businesses marketing strategies, advising on changes and improvements, and getting projects off the ground are all jobs that will be well paid for. 16. Online SEO Offering specific online SEO services is also another online freelancer role that businesses are crying out for. If you know how to improve a website’s SEO by doing keyword research, creating content that can rank in search engines, adding metadata/schema to posts and pages, and building back links to a domain, to name a few tasks, then this could be a great line of work for you. 17. Fiverr Using Fiverr is a great way to pick up work. Once you have signed up you can advertise your services. Fiver allows you to create your own gigs, whether you are offering web design, digital marketing, writing, or something else. You can choose how much you want to charge (it can be more than a fiver) and people will then contact you if they are interested in working with you. Fiverr will not only help you get experience if you are just starting off as a freelancer, but it will also help you earn some extra cash. 18. Create Your Own Agency Once you have made a name for yourself as a successful freelancer in your field, quite quickly you will find that you are inundated with too much work to manage. So why not consider taking on other virtual employees and turn your one person show into an agency. Create And Monetize A Blog Creating your own blog can be a very effective way of topping up your monthly income. Or, for those lucky few who have blogs that really take off, it can become your main paycheck. But what are the key ways to make money from a blog? 19. Google AdSense Signing up with Google AdSense will enable you to make money from advertising on your blog. Google AdSense will place relevant ads around your site, and if your site visitors click on these ads, you will earn a fee. Although each click only amounts to small change, if your blog has high levels of traffic and lots of page views this will quickly amount to a reasonable sum. 20. Banner Adverts Creating space for banner ads on your website is another way to generate a revenue from adverts. However, for this type of advertising, you will need to contact businesses directly and ask them if they would like to advertise on your website. The upside is that you can charge a set amount, or even a recurring monthly fee, to business to promote their services on your site. Using a WordPress plugin like AdSanity is an effective way to manage this type of advertising.

response.answer_text: Step One: Decide what part of the world you hate worst and change it. Step Two: Pinch pennies. Example 1: you want to take someone out on a date. You've already decided you hate traffic. Do you go to the opera, with ticket price $80, followed by a Friday work rush commute downtown or do you meet at a public park with a river, take off your shoes and wade and then share peanut butter crackers and grapes? Example 2: one of my best friend's smoked weed all day long so she could just mellow out and she couldn't not smoke tobacco too. She never could understand why I never lacked money (we both had the same job and pay and hours) but I simply didn't have a $30 a week weed habit and a $40 a week cigarette habit and when I needed to get mellow I took the public park walk. Sometimes growing up and doing adult activities means giving up what your mind, heart and soul needs. Crayons only cost $20. Wealth is in what you value and receive back from investments in terms of time that meet your needs.

Almost everyone is interested to know how to make money online. Whether you’re in between jobs, a student, looking for a side gig, or just a fast hustle to make some extra cash, earning money online is a great way to pad your pocketbook and below are 7 cool ways to earn lots of money online 1. Blogging for Big Bucks Blogs are more popular than ever before. Back in the dark ages before the internet, if you had a niche hobby, then you were pretty much on your own when it came to sharing information about it. Nowdays, global connectivity makes it possible to connect with people who have the same interests as you. Blogging for money can be a great way to earn easy online cash. You can blog about anything that’s important to you or that interests you and get paid to do it. There are several ways that bloggers get paid, including: · Promoting affiliate products · Earning commission on the sale of affiliate programs · Selling products, content and information they make · Selling advertising space · Paid guest blogger opportunities 2. Virtual Assistants Make Bank from Home Freelance and virtual gig jobs are more common than ever before. One of the best jobs that anyone can do to make money online is being a virtual assistant. The process is simple, a business or client hires you to perform basic tasks. These might include things like booking airline travel, managing social media, answering emails, or data entry tasks. The best part of being a virtual assistant is that you can pick your rates, tasks, and clients. That means you’ll only work the jobs that you want to work and are worth your time. Many VA’s earn as much as $35 to $50 an hour for their services. Also, the demand for virtual assistants has been steadily increasing. It’s up 95% over the last three years. HorketHandBook is a great place to start your virtual assistant business today! 3. Teach English Online English is rapidly becoming the most dominant language in the world. That means the demand for English teachers in other countries is far outstripping the supply. One of the most common remedies to this situation is to hire online English teachers and tutors. The best part is that becoming one of these tutors is a great way to make money from home online! VIPKID is a service that offers online English teachers for instruction to Chinese students. The students are between 4-12 years old. They base their instruction on the US Common Core. You can teach for 90 minutes a day and make as much as $500 per month. All classes are online and the teachers make between $14 and $22 per hour. This is one of those stay at home mom jobs that can be done part time. 4. Freelance Writing Can Be a New Career The gig economy is growing all the time. But if you don’t want to drive strangers around in your car, freelance writing can be a great alternative. Lots of freelance writers make a full-time living picking up and completing projects online. This question is extremely broad , and a single definite answer will be impossible. However, there are many great guides out there on how to make money. A simple Google search will return a week’s worth of reading material. It entirely depends on your end goal. Bill Gates-esque billionaires didn’t become billionaires by asking themselves, “how can I get rich?” They became rich by developing and honing their personal skill-set and knowledge, and then taking an opportunity when they saw it. Becoming rich was a by-product of their knowledge and innovate minds. Bill Gates saw a new age of computing. Steve Jobs saw opportunity for the perfect user experience. The key is to become an expert or knowledgeable in something you are passionate about, and then using your knowledge to discover new opportunities for innovation. Don’t trust any sources that claim to be an “easy” way to earn “a lot” of money. Get rich quick doesn’t really work in real life. A rare few actually manage to make their first million before they’re 30. As far as making a lot of money is concerned, there are a few paths you can take: Go to college for a high-level degree in an in-demand field you have a passion for Start business ventures with the same mindset: in-demand and something you can get passionate about.

The best way to make a lot of money is through leveraging others people’s time and money. This is the way of all great wealth. For instance, Bill Gates is wealthy because millions of other people buy his products. This is created by having thousands of people work for him. All great financial empires are built by employing others and finding or creating a market that engages others to either invest their time or spend their money. I believe it was Andrew Carnegie who once said, “I’d rather than 1% of 100 people’s efforts, than 100% of my one.” The problem for any of us as individuals of course is how to do this. Theory is simple. Reality is difficult. I spent the first 10 years of my business life trying to build my own businesses. I was planning to be a millionaire by age 30. By 30, I was closer to owing a million instead of having a million. I found a better way, through a concept called multi-level marketing, in which you can build a team of people who also want to use leverage. I have been paid through this system for the past 25 years, with no end in sight, in fact my business has grown 500% in the past 10 years without me doing anything - it is being built by other people who are building their own business. It’s a greatly misunderstood business model to be sure, and has been subject to a number of scams and dishonest people who try to win by taking advantage of others, but when it is done ethically it is a thing of great equality. You can only get ahead in the long run by helping others get ahead. We all do the same thing. We are all partners with each other. It contains within its model the rare opportunity for money and the time to enjoy it. Once you have enough people in your team, building their own businesses, you can scale down your involvement, ofter to next to nothing. But you must find the right company, and the right organization of individuals in the field, the right training, to help you. To that end I have recently taken everything I’ve learned in the past 25 years and put it into an online training system, called Creating Sustainable Incomes with E-Commerce. I will only work with people who are pre-qualified and have a better than average chance of success. To see if you qualify, take my Career Aptitude Test:

The only way I know of to go from nothing to a large quantity of cash quickly is selling real estate via buying options and reselling the property at a higher rate.  Step By Step Guide: Find a motivated seller who is willing to sell a piece of property for what it is worth.Tell them you will sell it, buy an option on the house for $1 saying that you will purchase the house under the condition that you can find a buyer for a price greater than what you will "pay".Hold an aggressive marketing campaign to find interested buyers, possibly in an open-auction environment where the bid starts out low (the lower, the better, the more attention it will generate).  Print out lots of fliers, post them everywhere.  Host an open house auction over the course of 2 days.  Get the bidders to write down their contact info an open bid in your book.  Explain to them that this is like a poker game and that they do not reveal their true hand yet.After day 1, contact everyone on the list from highest bid to lowest and entice them to increase their bid.  Repeat this a couple of times until you can't get the price higher.Sell the option for the difference in the price you sold the property for and the price you agreed to buy the property for.  If you failed in getting enough interest or money, you're out of the $10 option and the cost of fliers - not a big loss.Save the names in your contact book in case you decide to do this again in the future.

There are many paths to huge money. It does depend on you though. You have not completed your profile so I have nothing to base my advice on. What skills do you have? What education do you have? What country and city do you live in? Are you willing to move? How good is your learning, intelligence, patience, willingness to adapt, willingness to put in the time and energy? And what is “huge money” to you? $100k, $500k, $1million a year? One path : Become a specialist surgeon in a western developed country. You’ll need straight A’s in high school and also university. Then commit yourself to working very hard to specialise and put in very very long hours learning, then qualify, then start your own practice then build a reputation as an excellent practioner then you can charge tens of thousands of dollars per surgery. It’s a 20 year plan to execute though. Same sort of plan for lawyer, investment banker, accountant, management consultant. All of these require excellent grades in school, university, acceptance to top firms and very very hard work and long hours and you’ll get there in the end once you make partner, bring in the clients and generate business. The vast majority of people lose money looking for get rich investing schemes, if it’s too good to be true, it’s too good to be true. CFD’s, commodities, trading, forex are all very high risk options that will most likely result in you losing everything if you don’t know what you are doing. Learning fundamental investing is the way to go but you also need to put in the time and energy to learn and start small and grow as you learn. You could start your own business. But the success rate is less than 5%. So not a safe option. It’s a slow and steady route with lots of hard work to huge money, there aren’t any shortcuts.

I am always frustrated with these questions…not by the question itself, but because 99% of the answers are either vague generalities (find your passion, solve a 1$ pb for millions of people and so on), or fully complete scams (hello binary options and affiliated marketing). Kudos for the drones idea (unfortunately not applicable in my country), which was the only worthy idea I’ve read before getting sick of the get rich quick schemes and other ponzis. So, ok, I released the pressure, no let’s get to it. There is no easy/safe/fast way to make big bucks. But they are good, slow and efficient ways. I have seen both my father and my uncle make a few million in RE within a few years. My father was quite traditional in his approach : buy low with leverage, he built our home and saved the last floor to put on rent and netted a positive cashflow, etc. these kind of things that you’ll find easily if you read about RE. My uncle, he went another way that I consider more interesting and worth sharing. He wanted to follow my dad’s path and make money in RE. But he didn’t had any capital and a low solvability that didn’t allow any mortgage. Also he is an impatient man (and that ultimately cost him his fortune, twice). So they sat together on the table, discussed a few hours, and he came out with the following scheme. He built a renovation company. He started small, doing a few works for farmers he knew. After a while, he got enough money to buy his first unit through a second company. Obviously a ruin he bought for a penny on the dollar. Then, he hired his first company to do the renovation work for, well, a very competitive cost. Rinse and repeat, he soon owned several dozens of units (I have never known exactly how much, I believe a bit under the hundred). That without starting capital. Nor a fancy degree.

YOU’RE DOING IT WRONG - CHANGE YOUR MINDSET FIRST! Instead of thinking about the money, think about what you love doing and then look for a job in that field. Your process should be: Passion ——-> Work ———-> Improvement ——-> Specialization ———-> Moving up the ranks ——-> Lots of money STEP 1: Find your PASSION Too many people go to work every day hating their job, you don’t want to be one of those people. Follow your passion and find a job you’ll love doing. 1. Websites That Pay Let’s go ahead and get this out of the way. There are all kinds of websites that will pay you for various things, such as shopping, taking surveys or testing products. No, I’m not getting paid to promote any of these and no, these websites won’t make you a millionaire, but they are great for earning some extra cash. I’ll leave out the scams. Here are some legitimate websites that pay: Swagbucks – Swagbucks is great for earning some extra cash. You can do a variety of things to make money, from taking surveys to using their search engine. You won’t get rich, but you will earn a few bucks. If you have the time to kill, you can spend it earning some extra cash, instead of surfing the web.InboxDollars – InboxDollars is similar to Swagbucks, since you’re going to be taking surveys, shopping, etc., so if you want to maximize your return, sign up with both websites. They also offer a search engine that pays you (like Swagbucks) and you get $5 just for signing up. I won’t continue to list survey sites one after another down the list, but if you want to get paid to take surveys, also check out GlobalTestMarket, E-Poll Surveys and Survey Club.Project Payday – Project Payday is one of those sites that has testimonials of people who have earned thousands of dollars by getting paid to get trial offers. I’m not saying you’ll earn thousands, but it is legit and you can earn some extra cash. They assume that by paying you to do a free trial, you’ll either like the product and purchase it, or forget to cancel the trial and get charged for it. If you can keep track and cancel before you get charged (if you don’t want the product), then this is a great site for making some money.User Testing – User Testing pays $10 a pop for testing websites. A test usually takes about 15-20 minutes. The purpose is for a website owner to watch someone, who is new to their site, try to navigate it. The value that the site owner gets by watching an actual user experience is worth a ton, but $10 isn’t a bad pay-out.Fiverr – Fiverr is a great place to make a few bucks or spend a few bucks if you need some of the services people offer. Basically, everything is $5. You either pay $5 or charge $5. They call them “gigs.” You can offer your services however you choose. If you sell art and you’re fine selling pieces for $5 each, that’s a gig. If you’re a graphic designer and you want to offer your services for $10/hour, simply offer a 30 minute gig. If they need two hours of graphic design, they pay you $20, or $10/hour by buying four gigs.IZEA – IZEA works in addition to a blog or on its own. You get paid to blog, tweet, take photos and take videos. The pay is mostly based on your following, so if you want to make money with your tweets, you’ll need to grow you Twitter following. Likewise, if you want to make money with blogs, you’ll need substantial blog traffic (more on blogging below).2. Freelance Writing Freelance writing is one of the most popular ways to earn money online. Many successful freelancers can earn an average of 50 cents to a dollar per word. Some are earning twice that! Of course, it doesn’t start out like that. You’ve got to build your portfolio and your résumé, blah blah blah. If you’re interested in writing, I’m sure you know this. If you’re not interested in writing, I wouldn’t recommend traveling down this road just for the money. It takes dedication and time, though it can be highly profitable if it’s what you love. Assuming it is what you love, let’s talk about making money with it. Before you decide to start reaching out to all of these freelance writing companies, you need to have a web presence. You need a blog (in my humble blogger opinion, of course). Or you could just have an online portfolio. Even a LinkedIn profile works to get started. When you’re ready to start, here are 150 resources to help you write better, faster and more persuasively. If that’s intimidating, just start with these 50 resources. Now for what you’ve all been waiting for; once you’re ready to actually start making money, here are 10 websites you can start with: Listverse – Listverse pays $100 for each accepted post. The article must be a list, it must be at least 1,500 words and you must include at least 10 things. Other than that, you can get pretty creative with it.TopTenz – TopTenz pays $50 for each accepted post. Again, the article has to be in a list format and it must be at least 1,500 words, with few exceptions. They post often so your chances of getting accepted are fairly high.A List Apart – A List Apart pays $200 for each accepted post. They’re not first on the list, because they tend to publish less articles, which means you have a smaller chance of getting accepted. Same guidelines as above, 1,500 word minimum.International Living – International Living pays $75 for each accepted post. They are mostly looking for travel experiences from countries you have visited. For this site, it’s more about your experience than your writing ability.FundsforWriters – FundsforWriters pays $50 for each accepted post. They are looking for articles about writing and making money with it. They only accept articles between 500-600 words, but they want you to make each word count.Uxbooth – Uxbooth pays $100 for each accepted post. They do tend to take four to eight weeks to accept and post articles, so don’t count on this being a quick money maker. They take so long, because they pair with editors to only publish amazing content.iWriter – iWriter pays up to $15 for each accepted post. That may seem small, but they aren’t as strict as many of the others above and they also allow you to pick exactly what you write. You can write as many or as few articles as you want.Textbroker – Textbroker pays up to five cents per word, if you’re a 5-star writer. You’ll start by submitting a short sample article and you will most likely start as a 3-star writer, but you can work your way up by writing more and writing great content.Matador Network – Matador Network pays up to $60 for each accepted post, but standard pay is around $20-$25. They don’t really focus on a minimum word count, but they have a maximum count of 1,500 words.The Penny Hoarder – The Penny Hoarder pays up to $800 (rarely), depending upon the number of page views you receive. The pay starts at $100 for 50,000 page views, so this isn’t a guaranteed paid article, but it can potentially be highly rewarding.There’s no doubt that you can make money with freelance writing, but it’s a process. Once you start building your portfolio and your writing skills, you can start making some serious money. If you’re not an experienced writer, expect to put some time in before you really start to see some dough. 3. Sell Your Stuff Ever since the idea of online auctions came into existence, the online selling market has been on the rise. Many are interested, but don’t know how to get started. There are still all kinds of ways to make money by selling online, whether you’re selling what you already have or buying and selling like a store. Before we get started, here are a few general tips when selling anything online: Get a PayPal account. If you don’t have a PayPal account, you’ll want to get one if you’re doing business online. It’s the standard in online business for receiving payment and paying others.Take good pictures. Some of the options below don’t require you to actually take the picture and sell the product, but for the ones that do, make sure you take a clear picture that makes your product stand out from the others. If you’re going to be taking a lot of pictures, set up a small “studio-like” area in your home with a backdrop and proper lighting to really make your pictures come across as professional. And of course, you’ll want a good camera too.Be honest. If you’re selling used items, be honest about every dent, scratch, blemish, etc.. This will reduce many issues you could run into and keep your reviews positive.Do good business. Plain and simple. Whether you’re selling on a small site or opening an online store, your customer service matters. You’ll want to get those positive reviews and make a good name for yourself. Respond to questions, concerns and complaints. Offer a guarantee if available.Follow those guidelines and you will do well in online sales. When you’re ready to start selling, here’s where you go: Amazon – Have you heard of FBA? It stands for “Fulfilled by Amazon” and it’s getting pretty popular. Basically, you buy products (in bulk is best) and ship them to Amazon for them to store. When your products sell, Amazon packs them up, ships them out and sends you the money (after taking their cut). There are people making a full-time living from FBA, while others just do it for some extra money.CraigsList – Some things don’t ship very well. Other things may make you feel uncomfortable to sell to someone across the country. Anytime you’re selling a large item or something you just don’t want to ship, Craigslist is a great place to go. It’s simple to list your item (again, take good pictures!). If you don’t like the idea of putting your phone number out there, the interested individual can send you a message to your inbox without even getting your email address.eBay – Of course you can’t read an article about making money online that doesn’t mention eBay. You can start an eBay store and get serious about it or you can just sell some stuff to declutter your home. Either way, I’ve made my fair share from selling on eBay and it’s still a popular way to earn money. If you decide to start an actual eBay store, you’ll want to find a drop-ship business like Doba that will store and ship items straight to your customers so you don’t have to deal with an inventory.Etsy – If you like to create arts and crafts, you can sell them on Dove puoi trovare di tutto da creativi di tutto il mondo’s completely free to open an Etsy store. You simply sign up, post pictures of your creations and starting selling. You can choose your payment option, but PayPal is generally the easiest. Etsy makes it easy to sell and keep track of your inventory. There is a small listing fee and they take 3.5% of every sale you make.Facebook – Facebook swap shops are great for selling things locally. It’s like CraigsList, but a little easier. You simply search for swap shops in your area and ask to join the group. Once you’re in, take a picture of the item, write a quick description with the price and post it. It doesn’t get much easier than that. You can generally expect to get about what you would get at a yard sale, maybe a little more.I propose to you 3 ways

There are many ways to grow your money financially. Here are some areas which may want to consider… put your excess cash in high-yield interest offering accounts, such as fixed or variable term deposits with banks,invest in assets or properties which are safe and would yield higher returns in terms of rental yields and capital appreciation,invest in stocks and unit trusts that are safe and have good growth potential,invest in businesses or startups that you feel have good future and business potential…There are lots more investment initiatives in your country, I am sure, but the list above would give your some idea. Anyway, if your sum of money available for investment is large, I recommend you approach a good financial advisor or a bank manager to suggest some investment apparatus which you can get involved in. Whatever you may decide, always remember that high returns always involve higher risks of investments. Always be safe than sorry. If you are unsure of what you have been recommended or that your gut feeling feels not right in certain investment advice, then move away from it. During the interim, simply placed your extra cash in fixed term deposits with banks, as they are usually safer in the long run.

Become very valuable. Reverse-engineer what successful people do to earn a lot of money. There is one thing that all successful people have in common, and that is the simple fact that they have “high value”. They’re not average people. They have one or many things that they do extremely well. Steve Jobs = Extraordinary Visionary Kevin Hart = Extraordinary Comedian Bill Gates = Extraordinary Business Man Michael Jackson = Extraordinary Performer Michael Jordan = Extraordinary Basketball Player All of the examples above are people who earn a lot of money because they have a lot of value and they demonstrate that value every day. When you become valuable and you’re able to demonstrate your value, people will pay you. Find something that you love to do, figure out how you can make money from it, and then get extremely good at it!

Affiliate Marketing is a good way.You sell products from other people. As a marketer, you can join an affiliate program and promote products (physical or electronic) or services through your website.Affiliate marketing is an effective and productive technique of marketing. It is a cooperative effort (commercial partnership) between a merchant and one or more affiliates.The merchant rewards the affiliate when he brings a visitor on the website or when he is selling the product or merchant service. It is a system which usually consists of four distinct elements: the publisher (affiliate), the advertiser (merchant), the consumer and the network. The advertiser, also known as merchant , is an individual or a company that sells a product or service. The advertiser is associated with it (or them) editor (s) to promote the advertiser's products and services. The editor, also known as the marketer or affiliate is a person who promotes products and services. The publisher is partnering with the advertiser to promote the latter's goods and services. The publisher uses ads, links and creates marketing campaigns to find buyers for the advertiser's products and services. For every product sold, the advertiser gives a commission to the editor The consumer, you all know. It's you and me. Antidote (affiliate link) defines the term consumer as follows: A person who uses goods or services to meet their needs The network, also known as program name or platform, acts as an intermediary between the advertiser and the publisher. The network makes life easier for the editor to find and participate in a marketing affiliate program. The network also provides access to a greater number of advertisers and publishers. Some networks have membership fees while others will take some of the profits from the advertiser when a sale is concluded So , for me is this the best way to make money :)

The best way to make more out your money is to invest it. Now, you must be thinking, how? The answer is simple - invest in Mutual Funds. There are various types of Mutual Funds available that help you invest your money according to your risk profile and needs. I have mentioned these types for you, so that you can choose the best one for you. Equity Funds: These are Mutual Funds that invest in market-linked instruments like stock market. The risk profile of these funds is higher and the returns are volatile (depending on the market fluctuations). To know more, read Equity funds | Equity Mutual Funds | Best Equity Mutual Funds Debt Funds: A debt fund invests in fixed income instruments. These funds invest in fixed income securities like bonds, etc. Debt funds are suitable for those who are looking for steady income with relatively lower risks, as its comparatively less volatile than equities. To know more, read Debt Funds | Types of Debt Mutual Funds | Bonds | Best Debt Funds Balanced Funds: Balanced funds are investments that devote more than 65% of their assets in equities and the rest of them in debt instruments. The beneficial factor of a balanced fund is that they provide equity comparable returns with a lower risk factor. To know more, read Hybrid Funds or Balanced Funds | Categories of Hybrid Mutual Funds So, to earn money, simply invest in Mutual Funds

What I would do if I needed to earn lots of money is start finding a niche or an area that I might be an expert in or at least have some experience in. I would head over to Amazon and search for books in my niche and sort by popularity. Then look for the books that were the most popular and scan through the topics in the book and start jotting those down. Next I would check out the reviews for those books both good and bad and use that as an idea generator for what I will be creating next. Once I have my topic, subtopics and review data, I would head over to google slides and start putting together slides for my new online course. Once the slides have been completed, I would record the presentation and package it up as my new digital product. Finally I would reach out to friends, family and relatives and letting them know about my new online course that will help them with ________________. Of course since I have experience and an expert in my topic, I would price it at $997 and include a group coaching offer if its feasible. If people cannot afford my group coaching, they can still learn a lot from my self-study course without personal access to me. I just need to talk to as many people out there and focus on selling just five of my courses to hit my goal. :) I hope this helps! Faisal

Well, it depends on what for you is “a lot of money”. Let us assess the money a porn performer can earn by filming alone. There are several factors that have to be taken into account, and, of course, there is negotiation skill playing in. Generally, the more famous and the more popular an actor or actress and in this case, the porn performer is, the higher the payment per scene. The following figures are from the article “Porn's dirtiest secret: What everyone gets paid”: An actress is usually paid about $800 to $1000 for a traditional sex scene (boy/girl) at average, top stars can make up to $ 1500, in more rare cases (very popular actresses) up to $ 2000, while newcomers might earn a measley $ 300. More extreme sexual practices result in higher payments (I will come to that below). The average male performer makes $500-$600 per scene or day, well known male performers may earn $700-$900 and top stars up to $1,500. Payment also varies by the sex acts to be performed. The following figures are a rough guideline of what is being paid, taken from “How much money can you make? - How to be a Porn Star”. These are rates for actresses, female performers, in LA or Las Vegas: Solo (or softcore photo shoot only) $150 – $350 Traditional sex scene (boy/girl) $600 – $1000 Anal (boy/girl) $1000 – $1500 Anal (girl/girl) $800 – $1200 Group Sex $1200 – $2000 Double Penetration – $1100 – $1400 You see, these three factors (sex, popularity, type of sex acts performed) already results in quite a wide range. And these are only the rates. Here you can make your first choice if they are making a lot of money per scene or not. Giving absolute numbers of total income is not easy, as the total income made on performing in porn films highly depends on the number of scenes - this means, an average male porn performer doing two scenes per week will make more money per year from filming than a top female star doing, say, one scene per month. But that is only one possible revenue stream. For female porn performers, other revenue streams are available like stripping or escorting. In addition, the “more extreme scenes” to increase income is mostly, if not only, available to female performers. Thus, in a nutshell, female porn performers can do very well financially while the opportunities of male performers are limited, though their career can span a lot more years. As you see, there might not be an easy answer. But income is based on the amount of work done and you can play around with the figures above to estimate how much work needs to be done to make what you feel is “a lot of money”. If that is “a lot” or not is largely up to your definition of “a lot”. Hope that helps.

I would take a very different approach than what most have recommended. I’ve made multiple 7 figures online using this approach. Now, don’t get me wrong, many of the ways mentioned here work also. They just aren’t the most efficient way… And they take a lot longer. With the way I’m about to describe, you can earn your first $30–50 today if you set up it quickly and do it right. With the right amount of work it will turn into much more and can turn into a full-time business. I would do it all with Quora to start with. I would make that my single focus for the next 3 months. It will take some hard work, but the effects will start to compound over time. You can branch out into other channels once you see some success. Let me explain what I would do. * Before we get started it’s extremely important that you’re always adding value to your audience, and to the people on Quora, when doing this. Here’s how. 1. Pick a good product or service that you have purchased in the past and REALLY believe in. Find a good product in a niche that ideally you know something about. I’m going to take the “make money blogging” niche as an example. I may have taken a particular course that helped me tremendously and helped me earn my first $1 online. Although a little expensive at the price point of $497, I truly believe that the course is great. It adds a tremendous amount of value that I haven’t seen elsewhere in other courses. I apply to become their affiliate. I get a unique link that tracks everyone that I refer, and if someone purchases, I get 50% commission. This means you only need 3–4 sales a week to reach your target. 2. Create freebie that this audience would be interested in Now that I know which product I want to promote, I need to think of creating a useful freebie with awesome information. It’s important that it’s congruent with the product that I will be promoting. I’m going to come up with a well-researched freebie called: “The Earning Potential of the Top 27 Blogging Niches” I will give this away to anyone that is willing to sign up to my email list in exchange. 3. Set up a landing page to capture emails in exchange for this freebie Next, I set up a quick landing page using a page builder like ClickFunnels. Any other page builder will work fine as well - this is jus the one I’ve had success with. My landing page will highlight all the benefits of this freebie, and how it’s able to help my audience overcome their problem. Making money online by writing a blog. I will offer it to anyone that visits the page in exchange for their email address. 4. Update Quora Profile and show them where to download this freebie Next, I’m going to update my Quora profile and add a link to the landing page with the freebie. I’m going to showcase my credentials as a blogger and what I have achieved. Even if I’ve only made $1 online, it’s bound to be more than many others have done. I’m going to use language that makes it irresistible for anyone that reads my profile to click on the link going to my landing page. This is where they will find the freebie. 5. Drive traffic by answering relevant Quora questions Now it’s time to start driving traffic traffic to my profile. I’m going to find relevant questions on Quora with anything that have to do with “making money online”, “blogging”, “affiliate marketing”. I’m going to make sure that I only answer questions that have an answer to follower ratio of 1:5 to make sure that I get visibility on Quora. I’m going to make my answers as in-depth and helpful as I possibly can to make that my answers get upvoted. I want to be at the top of every question I answer so that I get maximum visibility. I’m also going to include a call to action for them to check out my profile in my answers, or where relevant, a direct link to my landing page. This will start driving Quora traffic to my landing page and help me build up my mailing list. Referall traffic from Quora is some of the most relevant traffic out there! 6. Create valuable content that helps your audience I’m going to be emailing everyone on my list on a daily basis by setting up an autoresponder using a tool like ConvertKit. I’ll be providing them with useful tips and insights on how to make money blogging that will really help my audience. I’m also going to share little tidbits from my life to build a relationship with my audience. I want them to really get to know me as a person and to start to like me My audience will start to trust me and view me as an authority. 7. Promote the product that has helped you Every three days or so, I will mention that I was able to learn how to make money blogging through the course that I am an affiliate for. I will recommend my audience to check it out and click on the link that I will put at the bottom of my email. To entice them further, I will also add a special bonus for anyone that ends up purchasing the course through my link. I’m going to offer a 30-minute coaching 1-on-1 call to anyone that purchases the product through my link. I will show them exactly how I used the program to make my first $1 online and give them tailored suggestions on how they can do the same. This will drive many of my audience to purchase the program through my affiliate link. This is when I’ll start making my first commissions. 8. Add in other traffic sources Only once I’ve made a few sales and have started making money would I add in other traffic sources. If you don’t have a converting offer, spending time on things like SEO, paid traffic, and all of the other suggestions made here - is likely a HUGE waste of time. Only once I have proven that my idea works, and my offer converts, I will focus on these. Conclusion Doing this every day will very quickly get you your first $30 day online using traffic from Quora. Then shortly after to a level of $50 per day. And eventually it could become a full-time business. And the good news is that you’ll be building your OWN email list and your OWN audience. No one can ever take that way from you! You can do this in any niche - whether it’s make money online, weight loss, or dating. As long as you are one step ahead of your audience in their journey, you’re able to help them. The most important thing is to be genuine with your audience and help them solve THEIR problems. I was ultimately able to use many of these strategies to grow my own business to 7 figures also. And was finally able to quit my job and live life on my terms. And I’m going to start a case study where I’ll do exactly this by growing a brand new blog to $10,000 per month in only 12 months.

Make a list of things that you are good at. Can you play a musical instrument or sing, are you good at math or problem solving, are you a people-person and are outgoing and friendly, etc.?Make a list of things that you are passionate about. As a middle school teacher, I encourage my students to try to find a career in a field they have a natural interest or love for.See where list one and two overlap. My neighbor’s son loves music and business, so he went to U.S.C. and double majored in music and entrepreneurship.Figure out what you need to do to prepare for your “dream job”. Becoming a professional athlete, CPA, rock star, physician, or small business owner each involves a different series of steps to achieve your goals.What are your priorities? As a teacher I’ll never make a fortune, but my kids have gone to my school (I teach at a K-9) since kindergarten and I’ve spent a lot of quality time with them. There are a lot of wealthy, unhappy people in the high-SES community in which I teach, and there are a lot of happy people who don’t make a lot of money. Life is all about balance.

‘Lots of money’ has different amounts for different people. Doing a budget is mandatory to see what you need- though that obviously changes with age, marriage, kids, jobs and so on. Then you have retirement. It is a ‘major’ item since it keeps on changing. However, you want to stay ahead of the game by earning more than you need. But that is for emergencies, health issues, etc., You do not have to become rich- whatever that may mean. Living in San Francisco is obviously much different than Boise. Don’t try to amass money for the sake of loved ones, family, etc. since you may end up alone when you die. Such decisions must be identified throughout life.

For these kinds of people changing jobs continuously until they find the right one is always the best solution. Let’s look into some statistics: 1.The International survey asked "Which of the following best describes how much you love your current job?" The Indian workers came up with the following responses: 18% Love it - would do it for free( But anyway you will get money)37% Like it a lot - I enjoy what I do, but I could like it more33% Like it - I like it well enough for now5% Don't like it - I think I could do better0% Hate it - but it is a necessary evil8% Did not answer2. According to a 2012 survey conducted by "Big 4" accounting firm Deloitte, 80% of those surveyed did not like their jobs. In another survey conducted by Gallup in 2013, 63% of the 230,000 employees in the survey said they were unhappy with their jobs. 3.Here's some of that data: 96% of the poor did not like what they did for a living.86% of the rich liked what they did for a living.7% of the rich loved what they did for a living.But for Indian’s they are so lucky. A recent International survey data that looks at levels of job satisfactions among Indian workers shows that over half of the workers (55 per cent) love or like their job, placing India at third position in International Happiness Rankings, behind Canada and the Netherlands. According to the survey, one in five Indians love their job so much and no Indian worker says that they hate their job. i.Rich people who liked their job Eighty-six percent of the rich people in my Rich Habits study liked what they did for a living. It's clear, from my data, that in order to become wealthy you must at least like what you do for a living. Those rich people who at least liked what they did for a living accumulated an average of $3.4 million. It took them thirty two years to accumulate their wealth. ii.Rich people who loved their job Only 7% of the rich people in my study loved what they did for a living. But what shocked me was how important loving what you do for a living is to wealth accumulation. Those rich people who loved what they did for a living accumulated an average of $7.4 million, or $4 million more, than the wealthy who liked their jobs. It took this group of rich people twelve years to accumulate their wealth, or twenty fewer years than the first group. From my research regarding pursuing a dream job: When you love what you do for a living, you'll spend more time doing it.When you spend more time doing what you love to do for a living, you'll get better at doing it.When you are better at what you do than your competition, the world will pay you more money.When you make more money than your competition, you can accumulate more wealth in a shorter period of time.The final lesson, I believe, sums everything up: If you want to become richer quicker, find a job that you love and never quit.For some professions you can consider Actor, Athlete, Physician/Surgeon, Investment Banker, Engineering Manager, Software Developer/Software Architect, Product Management Director,Actuary, Corporate Lawyer.

Assuming you have some funds available to spend, you could start investing. There are many types of investing, like in bonds, stocks, mutual funds, savings, CDs, etc. These sorts of investments will generally be supplied with a dividend every so often (money that goes into your pocket), or an interest rate (raises the value of your investment), or the ability to trade your investment with someone else for profit. If you are looking into make small and safe amounts of money over a long course of time; then all you should need to do is save your money and watch it grow. If of course you want to be a bit riskier with your wallet, then you could go about Trading investments, which you can find more information about here: How To Start Trading. Some rule of thumb that generally applies anywhere in the money world is that High Risk = High Reward, and Low Risk = Low Reward.

If you are unsure of what you have been recommended or that your gut feeling feels not right in certain investment advice, then move away from it. During the interim, simply placed your extra cash in fixed term deposits with banks, as they are usually safer in the long run.

This answer is ok One instantly came to my mind — The Radium Girls. They were a major factor in the labor codes as we know it today. It’s the story of how during WWI, women went to work in the factories to replace the men who had gone off to fight. Some factories produced clocks, which the women would paint with radium, which glowed. Back then, some of the women who worked in the factories glowed due to exposure to the radium — and that was considered fashionable. The process goes to paint each clock goes like this: the girls would dip their paintbrush in the radium paint. They would then put the radium-coated brush in their mouth to create a fine point, and then apply the paint. They did this for every single clock — meaning hundreds, thousands of times. When the women began to experience the effects of putting radium into their bodies, the companies denied it, leading to a court battle (The women had even asked if it was safe to work with radium, which the companies assured them it was) The one fact I remember the most is how the women continued to testify, even as they were lying on their deathbeds, knowing that it might be too late for them. They did it for the future workers, even as they faced horrifying side effects (radium weakens the bones. One doctor broke a girl’s wrist just by examining it; another doctor was able to pull a girl’s jaw out with no surgical equipment) Eventually the Radium Girls won after a long court battle — marking one of the first times a company was held responsible for their workers’ safety. I’m surprised I never learned this in history class.
